mta.ads.smid.patterns
Class ObserverPool<T>

java.lang.Object
  mta.ads.smid.patterns.ObserverPool<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The interface which defines which calls can be made to the listeners.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
 class ObserverPool<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

The ObserverPool is a proxy which allows calls to an interface to be forwarded to a set of listeners.

Author:
Steven Jeuris

removeObserver

boolean removeObserver(T observer)
Remove an observer to which calls where being made.

Parameters:
observer - The observer to remove.
Returns:
True, when the observer was found and removed, false otherwise.

createEventDispatcher

T createEventDispatcher(java.lang.Class observerClass)
Create the proxy which allows to dispatch all calls to the observers.

Parameters:
observerClass - The interface class of the observers.
Returns:
The dispatcher which can be used to make calls to all added observers.

                               java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                               java.lang.Object[] args)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
invoke() implementation of InvocationHandler. This is called whenever a call is made to an event dispatcher.
